Matters Arising16 Apr 2025

elements.title: The phased pan-genome of tetraploid European potato (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The phased pan-genome of tetraploid European potato

A haplotype-resolved pan-genome of autotetraploid European potato founder lines shows high nucleotide diversity at remarkably low haplotype diversity, which is probably the result of hybridization events with wild potato species, followed by population bottlenecks during domestication and transition to Europe.

  • Hequan Sun
  • Sergio Tusso
  • Korbinian Schneeberger
ArticleOpen Access16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Metformin reduces the competitive advantage of Dnmt3aR878H HSPCs (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Metformin reduces the competitive advantage of Dnmt3aR878H HSPCs

Dnmt3a mutations in mouse haematopoietic stem and progenitor cells equivalent to R882 mutations in human cause increased mitochondrial respiration, suggesting that this is a mechanism of clonal haematopoiesis and a potential therapeutic target.

  • Mohsen Hosseini
  • Veronique Voisin
  • Steven M. Chan
Article16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Electric-field-induced domain walls in wurtzite ferroelectrics (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Electric-field-induced domain walls in wurtzite ferroelectrics

Experimental and theoretical exploration of domain walls forming in wurtzite ferroelectrics following the application of electric fields demonstrates their reconfigurable conductivity as well as tunability, showing potential for use in ultrascaled devices.

  • Ding Wang
  • Danhao Wang
  • Zetian Mi
Article16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Multi-zonal liver organoids from human pluripotent stem cells (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Multi-zonal liver organoids from human pluripotent stem cells

Liver organoids derived from human induced pluripotent stem cells populations grown with ascorbate and bilirubin can be used to recapitulate differential zonal functions of human hepatocytes and for transplantation in animal models of liver dysfunction.

  • Hasan Al Reza
  • Connie Santangelo
  • Takanori Takebe
Article16 Apr 2025

elements.title: A pangenome reference of wild and cultivated rice (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A pangenome reference of wild and cultivated rice

A pangenome of wild and cultivated rice accessions captures the entire set of non-redundant genes and diversity in rice, and provides insights into the pathways involved in the evolution of rice.

  • Dongling Guo
  • Yan Li
  • Bin Han
ArticleOpen Access16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Structure of the ATP-driven methyl-coenzyme M reductase activation complex (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Structure of the ATP-driven methyl-coenzyme M reductase activation complex

The structure and function of the MCR activation complex from Methanococcus maripaludis were revealed, demonstrating its ATP-dependent ability to activate MCR and form methane while uncovering a unique electron transfer pathway involving iron–sulfur clusters similar to the nitrogenase cofactor intermediates.

  • Fidel Ramírez-Amador
  • Sophia Paul
  • Jan Michael Schuller
ArticleOpen Access16 Apr 2025

elements.title: An ultrasensitive method for detection of cell-free RNA (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
An ultrasensitive method for detection of cell-free RNA

A method, RARE-seq, for sensitive detection of cell-free RNAs in blood is demonstrated to have diverse clinical applications including diagnosing and characterizing human cancers, and tracking response to RNA therapeutics.

  • Monica C. Nesselbush
  • Bogdan A. Luca
  • Maximilian Diehn
Article16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Observation of the axion quasiparticle in 2D MnBi2Te4 (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Observation of the axion quasiparticle in 2D MnBi2Te4

The dynamical axion quasiparticle, which is directly analogous to the hypothetical fundamental axion particle, is observed in two-dimensional MnBi2Te4, and has implications for quantum chromodynamics, cosmology and string theory.

  • Jian-Xiang Qiu
  • Barun Ghosh
  • Su-Yang Xu
Article16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Subnanosecond flash memory enabled by 2D-enhanced hot-carrier injection (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Subnanosecond flash memory enabled by 2D-enhanced hot-carrier injection

A two-dimensional Dirac graphene-channel flash memory based on a two-dimensional-enhanced hot-carrier-injection mechanism that supports both electron and hole injection is used to make devices with a subnanosecond program speed.

  • Yutong Xiang
  • Chong Wang
  • Peng Zhou
ArticleOpen Access16 Apr 2025

elements.title: A sharp volatile-rich cap to the Yellowstone magmatic system (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A sharp volatile-rich cap to the Yellowstone magmatic system

Seismic reflection imaging beneath the northeastern Yellowstone caldera reveals a sharp boundary at about 3.8 km depth, which is inferred to result from a mixture of supercritical fluid and magma filling the pore space.

  • Chenglong Duan
  • Wenkai Song
  • Fan-Chi Lin
Article16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Driven bright solitons on a mid-infrared laser chip (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Driven bright solitons on a mid-infrared laser chip

New fully integrated semiconductor laser architectures are shown to be able to generate bright and background-free picosecond solitons at GHz repetition rates in the mid-infrared range.

  • Dmitry Kazakov
  • Theodore P. Letsou
  • Federico Capasso
Article16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Phase I/II trial of iPS-cell-derived dopaminergic cells for Parkinson’s disease (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Phase I/II trial of iPS-cell-derived dopaminergic cells for Parkinson’s disease

After transplantation into the brain of patients with Parkinson’s disease, allogeneic dopaminergic progenitors derived from induced pluripotent stem cells survived, produced dopamine and did not form tumours, therefore suggesting safety and potential clinical benefits for Parkinson’s disease.

  • Nobukatsu Sawamoto
  • Daisuke Doi
  • Jun Takahashi
ArticleOpen Access16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Chromosome end protection by RAP1-mediated inhibition of DNA-PK (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Chromosome end protection by RAP1-mediated inhibition of DNA-PK

Biochemical, structural and genetic analysis of the shelterin complex reveal that by recruiting RAP1 to DNA, TRF2 directly inhibits DNA-dependent protein kinase to regulate classical non-homologous end joining at telomeres.

  • Patrik Eickhoff
  • Ceylan Sonmez
  • Max E. Douglas
ArticleOpen Access16 Apr 2025

elements.title: Antiferromagnetic quantum anomalous Hall effect under spin flips and flops (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Antiferromagnetic quantum anomalous Hall effect under spin flips and flops

A new device based on 7-septuple-layer MnBi2Te4 covered with an AlOx capping layer enables the investigation of antiferromagnetic quantum anomalous Hall effect over wide parameter spaces.

  • Zichen Lian
  • Yongchao Wang
  • Yayu Wang
Article16 Apr 2025
